metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6197 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
fs/overlayfs/dir.c in the OverlayFS filesystem implementation in the Linux kernel before 4.6 does not properly verify the upper dentry before proceeding with unlink and rename system-call processing, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) via a rename system call that specifies a self-hardlink. It was discovered that the OverlayFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly verify dentry state before proceeding with unlink and rename operations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').

linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1').
